Riot balance team counters Sona quite hard.
There are buffs to her base stats on the pbe atm so maybe she will be not a sitting duck when the skin comes out.
These "buffs" come along with new nerfs...

They are buffing her base ad meaning her autos hurt more, they are reverting the movement speed nerf, and they are taking some health per level to boost her health at level 1. She is very squishy early game so this helps her more than hurts her. The only change that is a rather sizeable nerf is the mana regen nerfs although this is probably to stop her from mindlessly spamming. I assume that if this change hurts her to much they will increase the effects of a spell or two or just change it back but mindless spamming is rather dull in lane. Plus they are buffing her mana regen per level so she will be able to cast more as the game goes on. She already will have greater mana regen by level 8. Over all a buff to her.

>They are buffing her base ad meaning her autos hurt more, they are reverting the movement speed nerf, and they are taking some health per level to boost her health at level 1.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but in return for the level 1 health increase, don't they reduce her overall health per level, making her actually squishier than normal after a few levels?  That's just stupid, considering that her strong early game poke was countered by the fact that she was one of the squishiest champs in the game.  They're essentially trying to completely change her playstyle, for no stated reason other than "clarity".  I really don't think that an early to mid-game champ should have stats that balance out in the late game.

Actually because she starts at a higher point but ends at the same numbers at level 18 she gets an increase in health at all levels besides 18 but the difference is smaller later on such that maybe she has 50 more health post buff at level1 but by level 11 she only has 20 more health. This is a "train a is going X mph and accelerating @ Y mph/s, while Train B is going X+20 mph and accelerating @ Y-5 mph/s. At what point (p) does Train A pass Train B?" question, where train a is sona pre buff and the stats for both trains (sona's) meet @ Point P (level 18)

Can someone post a link to these changes? I was honestly working off of the assumption that Rito was out-and-out buffing sona, not balancing her for a stronger early but weaker late game. If this was the case, my mistake for working off of conjecture

* Base HP increased to 497.6 from 482.36
* HP Per Level decreased to 70 from 77

Source: http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/01/127-pbe-update.html

Since I'm not a math guy, I won't crunch the numbers, but it seems that she actually took a hit in mid to late-game health in order to get a 15.24 level 1 HP increase.  Not exactly worth it.

From reading the current PBE changes it seems riot is shifting sona's focus more towards relying your spells for pseudo-health and regen, disengaging or poking to discourage the enemy team from engaging. More or less forcing Sona to play more passive and smart as a mage who looks for good trades while she outranges/pokes/sustains her lane opponents.

I say this because @ level 4 Sona will effectively be at less total health than pre-tweak, however changes to her mana regen also mean that during the time she has more health post-tweak(levels 1-3) she instead has less mana regen meaning bad trades will hurt more during this time, but after this point she will have more mana regen allowing her to go for more good trades that she previously couldn't take advantage of because she ran the risk of going OOM.

In assessment, this is Riot's way of rewarding better Sona players who know how to trade effectively and punishing those who aren't positioning and trading to Sona's fullest potential
